intro: Lagenaria vulgaris var. depressa, commonly known as the bottle gourd or calabash, is a flowering plant in the gourd family, Cucurbitaceae. It is characterized by its large, bottle-shaped fruits that can grow up to several feet in length. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions and thrives in warm, humid climates. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, while its flowers are typically yellow and borne in clusters. The fruit is used in various culinary and industrial applications due to its versatility and durability.
